intro: Phymatopteris erythrocarpa, commonly known as the red-veined spleenwort, is a species of fern belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, evergreen fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its red-veined leaves that are often clustered in dense tufts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as on rock faces or in forest understories. Phymatopteris erythrocarpa is primarily found in temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.
